# First level header

## Second header level

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
knitr::kable(summary(cars), caption = "Dit is een genummerde tabel met een header, en met ID = 'cars'. De code wordt weergegeven. ")
```

You can refer to tables in this way (figuur \@ref(tab:cars)).

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Dit is een genummerde figuur met een caption. De code wordt niet weergegeven. "}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot. You can refer to figures in this way (figuur \@ref(fig:pressure)). You can also refer to equations, ex equation \@ref(eq:test).
